result.execSummary:
Isaac A Hudgen was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Isaac A Hudgen was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac A Hudgen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Isaac A Hudgen by video, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not waive extradition.  $25000.00 cash bond requested by State.  Argument by Atty Raabe.  Court ordered a $25000.00 cash bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Defendant has decided to waive the extradition.  Signed forms.  Deputy is to bring the forms to the courthouse for signature of judge.
